info.Description: The Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) is a self-administered survey based on the DSM-IV diagnostic criteria for major depressive disorder and incorporates other leading major depressive symptoms. PHQ-9 helps primary care clinicians diagnose and monitor depression in adults. The PHQ-9 is a nine-item questionnaire that asks patients to rate the frequency of certain symptoms in the past two weeks on a four-point scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 3 (nearly every day).

preamble: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

qa.1:
Little interest or pleasure in doing things: 
 a. Not at all. 
 b. Several days. 
 c. More than half the days. 
 d. Nearly every day.
qa.2:
Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless: 
 a. Not at all. 
 b. Several days. 
 c. More than half the days. 
 d. Nearly every day.
qa.3:
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much: 
 a. Not at all. 
 b. Several days. 
 c. More than half the days. 
 d. Nearly every day.
